full_summary:
Tender Announcement
Title: Kentville Research and Development Centre Building Envelope Study #
Number: WS4320744089-Doc4320744152, Amendment Number: 1

* Dates: 
  - Publication Date: November 30, 2023
  - Tender Closing Date: December 18, 2023, at 14:00:00 (Local Time)
  - Amendment Date: December 11, 2023
  - Expected Contract Start Date: December 20, 2023

Background: The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites experienced service providers to submit competitive bids for a building envelope study at the Kentville Research and Development Centre (KRDC) in Kentville, Nova Scotia. This tender is part of a Request for Proposal (RFP) against Supply Arrangement (SA) E0225-152290, Architecture and Interior Design Services.

**Notice Details**
* Procurement Method: Competitive bidding
* Selection Criteria: Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price
* Regions of Delivery: Nova Scotia
* Trade Agreements: Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement.

**Tender Documents**
The tender documents are available from the Government Electronic Tender Opportunities website. Requests for standby bids from qualified Firms qualified under the A2 discipline in the province of Nova Scotia are invited. A list of invited firms is contained within the tender documents.

**General Information**

*Contact Information*
Your name,
Rachel Miller (Department of Public Works and Government Services - PSPC).
 Email: rachel.miller@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca 
No phone number or fax number are listed.

**Tender Description**: This is a building envelope study required by the Department of Public Works and Government Services on behalf of the other department of Agriculture and Agri-Food (Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada). They are looking for proposals from firms invited for Architecture and Interior Design Services who are located in Nova Scotia. The firms that were qualified under the A2 discipline had to have been qualified for the province. Bidders may request a debrief if they have submitted a bid that has been unsuccessful.

Note that NS dot-ca or regional companies will match federal UW-terms, provided
